ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Indicator whether Follow up survey happened within stipulated open window
Delays in number of days outside the window the survey completed
Notes: Negative delay indicate for some reason, the survey was presented and completed earlier than the stipulated window. Positive delay indicate how many days after the stipulated window the survey completed

ElementDescription: Indicator identifies whether the follow up survey taken within COVID 19 pandemic time
These items indicate whether there are multiple positive trauma impact indicators combining pain, PCS and PTSD symptoms.
